" improved " momentum meter . if you thought it ridiculous last year , wait til you play ncaa 07 . ... not just half-baked product placement tool . bioware decision make game pre-date movies great one because it gave them considerable creative freedom , even within confines star wars brand . biggest reason why kotor won over 40 game-of-the-year awards ( yes , over 40 ) not because you get swing double-bladed lightsaber around use force powers ; it because story ! strong plot crucial every rpg , kotor doesn't disappoint . this plot course includes one biggest twists video game history ( all you fans out there know what i'm talking ! if you don't , then go out buy this game now ) . game principal characters , while somewhat stereotypical ( i.e. bastila condescending socialite snob , carth tough loner troubled past , etc ) , work very well together good chemistry , including you , created character . example , if you play female character , it soon becomes obvious carth develops feelings you , but he feels slightly guilty because he lost his wife not too long ago . you'll also find yourself acting mediator when some your allies don't get each other , i.e. canderous carth , because they fought opposite sides mandalorian wars took place five years before . aside character development , game feels very rich its " star wars-ness " -- example , some names bioware came up planets people feel sound like george lucas himself approved them . despite what i said earlier this review , cutting down your enemies lightsaber looking good doing it got one joys kotor . i admit when i first got dantooine verge becoming jedi , i trembling excitement i going build my own lightsaber , i wondered what color i going choose . said all , there some things keep this game getting 5 stars . i felt game bit linear ( able choose your planets any order only gives illusion open-ended gameplay ) . i hoping storyline would different depending whether i decide evil or good , but everything plays same , save few minor events certain conversations . also , there " doorway bug " causes you sometimes get stuck when moving through doorway or narrow corridors . when this happens you wiggle thumbstick free yourself ; i've never any real problems this bug , but it get distracting . also i found moving around menu screens problematic ; you press start go main menu , then you pull trigger buttons move screens , but often i pull trigger multiple times before game responds . also , i'm sure many people would agree game graphics not up xbox standards ; even ps2 capable doing better ! i don't usually gripe graphics , but textures some background buildings taris downright laughable . overall , i give bioware serious kudos taking daunting task like creating new star wars game , i sing their eternal praises actually making it fun . it not stretch say i bought xbox just play kotor ( few other titles , but that story ) , i'm glad i made investment . hey , stop reading this go play

star wars : jedi knight ii - jedi outcast . third game star wars dark forces series . introduction:i've pretty much always fan star wars , you may guessed , i'm fan many games based series . although star wars games often hit miss , when one succeeds , it usually succeeds beautifully . one most interesting ideas star wars game dark forces , released playstation one pc . although game itself horrendous , terribly-choppy framerate very poor level design , it something world never seen before - star wars first-person shooter . sequel , jedi knight , cleaned up lot problems , added some new innovations . now third game series , jedi outcast , arrived . like previous games this sub-series , it gotten multi-console release . read see how it fares ! overview : jedi outcast star wars first-person shooter . game one-player quest , well several different multiplayer modes . review : put it simply , this game everything original dark forces should . while not perfect , this game huge improvement over its predecessors . once again you play role kyle katarn , agent other dark forces titles . second death star destroyed , but many imperial forces still fight , so it up you infiltrate their hideouts exterminate them . graphics , most part , solid . i impressed how good they this kind game . nothing state-of-the-art , but they're still pretty damn good . control also given overhaul rightfully so , since this game lets you use force powers wield lightsaber . single-player mode extremely entertaining , fact game offers multiplayer options only adds overall value package . you save whenever you want single-player mode ! but , course , game isn't perfect . like earlier dark forces games , level design just not good . too many areas look alike , there too many instant death spots just too easy fall into . likewise , many cases your objectives unclear , some puzzles pain - i don't know you , but i buy first-person shooters shoot people , not solve puzzles ! because imbalanced puzzles often poor level design , it took me over hour just beat first level ! huge problem availability . lack custom control configuration also plagues game . this huge problem , since game limited control selections often clash what you're used this sort game . this game wasn't released consoles very high quanitites , so you're likely gonna shell out full new price just get used copy - my mind , it not worth price . sad but true . i recommend this game star wars fans , just warned it not perfect , it hard get copy . edition notes : this good game , but some strange reason it just wasn't available consoles very long . because this , even used copies fetch close original new retail price . this extremely annoying people like me who want get every star wars game . still , you should hunt it down if you're into this sort thing . overall : overall this best game dark forces sub-series thusfar . where game succeeds , it succeeds beautifully . i am impressed game , it just shame consular version not made readily available all would-be players . i strongly recommend this game if you get hold it - i doubt it disappoint any star wars fan

essentially , this platinum edition dvd three games bargain-bin price . i couldn't pass it up . i little trouble getting it launch first , but after little internet session , i back world rpg/rts hybrid excellence . seamless integration two elements makes truly unique experience . unlike other rts games , there many adventure elements , you aren't just plunked down each map ; you fight your way map map . unlike other rpg games , your hero won't able go it alone ; defeat foes lay their path , he/she call upon power armies six different races : human , elves , dwarves , orcs , trolls , dark elves . your avatar must find structures known rune monuments access his/her unique power using runes summon forth rune heroes armies . rpg element game limited essentially character you create beginning . your avatar , rune warrior , remnant powerful heroes served circle mages during time convocation . avatar completely under your control ; you choose name , equipment , gender , distribute skill points stat points they gain levels create unique character . you create punishing melee fighter , powerful sorcerer , deadeye archer , or any combination those other concepts . your avatar also summon rune heroes he/she goes ; these heroes other rune warriors whose levels classes fixed , so all you equip them best available items . you progress through game , you find more powerful hero runes summon better heroes hero monuments . rts element continuation system started warcraft , but few twists . you must find rune monument one six races ( human monument , dwarf monument , etc . ) , possess appropriate worker rune , building plans , unit plans summon army . once you summon your workers , they gather resources build necessary structures summon army . need appropriate building unit plans occasionally necessitates fully exploring each map , so not miss any . levels your military units depends level worker rune you used summon your workers , so you find higher-level worker runes your units gain levels become stronger . heart winter shadow phoenix help add dozens hours original order dawn campaign , granting you access higher levels , more powerful equipment , new heroes , more advanced units . one my favorites " walking fortress " troll unit hurls massive boulders enemy structures . you import your avatar order dawn into both expansions , allowing this hero complete epic adventure . shadow phoenix very challenging some most ridiculous boss fights i ever seen . several them require your avatar , rune heroes , full army bring down single foe . heart winter excellent continuation order dawn , adding new friends enemies , shadow phoenix harrowing challenging test strategy patience your rune hero moves towards their ultimate destiny . sum it up , this dvd plenty adventurous rts/rpg action wrapped around engrossing fantasy yarn should provide dozens hours quality entertainment . highly recommended .

nintendo ds lite ( 2006 . ) introduction : late 2004 , nintendo premiered nintendo dual screen , or nintendo ds short . despite skepticism many critics fans alike , new console quickly won audiences over . it nintendo best handheld console date . 2006 , nintendo released smaller , lighter version system , appropriately called ds lite . overview : nintendo released ds lite mid 2006 . new version system smaller than old version , features repositioned buttons/switches/etc , variable brightness levels , few other changes classic ds . it retails $130.00 comes three colors - white , black , pink . review : nintendo good job revising ds . many problems older version system fixed . here some highlights flaws new version . -the good- -smaller more compact than original ds . original ds rather bulky comparison some other handhelds market , it kind pain haul around . finally , we've got smaller , lighter version system easily transported . -variable brightness levels . you adjust brightness your liking this version ds . brighter levels use more battery power , lower levels use less , so you plan out how best use your battery life . -features clip game boy advance slot . unlike original ds , lite version includes clip goes slot where game boy advance games fit . this helps give system streamlined appearance , it keeps slot cleaner . -compatible e-reader . old ds , due its shape , couldn't use e-reader accessory . lite model shape better all around , it use it ! -available three cool colors . whether you want white , black , or pink , there color everyone . -repositioned buttons things . nintendo made system more convenient use moving buttons around spots easier use . -redesigned stylus . new stylus bigger thicker than ones old ds , all-around improvement . -compatible older ds . since it basically same system , you won't any compatibility issues . -the bad- -smaller isn't necessarily better every way . i big hands they fit old ds fine . shrinking it actually makes it little harder , some aspects , use all buttons . -still not compatible pre-game boy advance games . course i wasn't really expecting nintendo fix this . -still not compatible game boy advance multiplayer . thing i wasn't expecting fixed . overall : overall this nice improvement over original ds . there problems , but most part , just same problems original . if you haven't gotten ds yet , definitely go lite model . edition notes : ds lite relatively new should stores years come .

you coul just jump right . puzzles quite mix : several straight " games , " couple mechanical , including one that quite involved , some riddle-type , some inventory , kind slider , huge maze ( not counting castle itself , ) . there no timed puzzles you can't die . i liked way inventory worked : once you acquired requisite item , it automatically used relevant spot . so you didn't keep opening your inventory , picking up item , clicking it hotspot , etc . rest , they fairly straightforward ... except riddle-type . clues provided so obscure i can't believe anyone but designers could possibly make sense them . fortunately , game includes hint feature , which give three hints each puzzle , after which it offers solve puzzle you . i use " solve " feature once , when even clues explained didn't much enlighten me . but when you use " solve " feature , you don't actually get see solution , just result it . so i still don't know what puzzle ! hint feature also tell you if you don't prerequisistes necessary continue puzzle . if you use it when you're not puzzle-view , it clarify your next objective . i found both these aspects very helpful . i experience one bizarre glitch game : intervals , without reason or warning , sound would suddenly start stutter echo most annoying way . adjusting game settings no effect . i eventually discovered i could correct problem exiting game rebooting my computer . this seemed necessary once every couple hours . i completed keepsake 25 hours -- possibly little more . i deligthed it kept me busy so long most adventure games these days barely provide 10 hours play . some second part game get little draggy , lot toiling back forth through castle . however , keepsake good choice gamers who like straight adventure fantasy context . but glitch couple illogical puzzles , i would given it five stars . i eagerly look forward wicked studios ' next effort

star wars : jedi knight ii - jedi outcast . third game star wars dark forces series . introduction:i've pretty much always fan star wars , you may guessed , i'm fan many games based series . although star wars games often hit miss , when one succeeds , it usually succeeds beautifully . one most interesting ideas star wars game dark forces , released playstation one pc . although game itself horrendous , terribly-choppy framerate very poor level design , it something world never seen before - star wars first-person shooter . sequel , jedi knight , cleaned up lot problems , added some new innovations . now third game series , jedi outcast , arrived . like previous games this sub-series , it gotten multi-console release . read see how it fares ! overview : jedi outcast star wars first-person shooter . game one-player quest , well several different multiplayer modes . review : put it simply , this game everything original dark forces should . while not perfect , this game huge improvement over its predecessors . once again you play role kyle katarn , agent other dark forces titles . second death star destroyed , but many imperial forces still fight , so it up you infiltrate their hideouts exterminate them . graphics , most part , solid . i impressed how good they this kind game . nothing state-of-the-art , but they're still pretty damn good . control also given overhaul rightfully so , since this game lets you use force powers wield lightsaber . single-player mode extremely entertaining , fact game offers multiplayer options only adds overall value package . you save whenever you want single-player mode ! but , course , game isn't perfect . like earlier dark forces games , level design just not good . too many areas look alike , there too many instant death spots just too easy fall into . likewise , many cases your objectives unclear , some puzzles pain - i don't know you , but i buy first-person shooters shoot people , not solve puzzles ! because imbalanced puzzles often poor level design , it took me over hour just beat first level ! huge problem availability . lack custom control configuration also plagues game . this huge problem , since game limited control selections often clash what you're used this sort game . this game wasn't released consoles very high quanitites , so you're likely gonna shell out full new price just get used copy - my mind , it not worth price . sad but true . i recommend this game star wars fans , just warned it not perfect , it hard get copy . edition notes : this good game , but some strange reason it just wasn't available consoles very long . because this , even used copies fetch close original new retail price . this extremely annoying people like me who want get every star wars game . still , you should hunt it down if you're into this sort thing . overall : overall this best game dark forces sub-series thusfar . where game succeeds , it succeeds beautifully . i am impressed game , it just shame consular version not made readily available all would-be players . i strongly recommend this game if you get hold it - i doubt it disappoint any star wars fan

water effect especially nice . characters slightly less well-realised , but still quite good . sound also quite good . music beautiful , different haunting motif each character section castle . f/x somewhat limited bit repetetive : lots footsteps bird calls , fire water sounds , etc . however , they fit well design rest game , so i can't complain . i'm very surprised see so many complaints here dialog . i really saw nothing wrong it or voice acting . rather , conversation used explain points not necessarily elucidated action ( philosophy magical system , example ) well develop characters their relationships . i considered good writing , not opposite . game starts cute little tutorial , which one other game characters leads you through controls . i kind liked , i dislike reading manuals it obviated need kind introductory sequence you find lot games this type ; you coul just jump right . puzzles quite mix : several straight " games , " couple mechanical , including one that quite involved , some riddle-type , some inventory , kind slider , huge maze ( not counting castle itself , ) . there no timed puzzles you can't die . i liked way inventory worked : once you acquired requisite item , it automatically used relevant spot . so you didn't keep opening your inventory , picking up item , clicking it hotspot , etc . rest , they fairly straightforward ... except riddle-type . clues provided so obscure i can't believe anyone but designers could possibly make sense them . fortunately , game includes hint feature , which give three hints each puzzle , after which it offers solve puzzle you . i use " solve " feature once , when even clues explained didn't much enlighten me . but when you use " solve " feature , you don't actually get see solution , just result it . so i still don't know what puzzle ! hint feature also tell you if you don't prerequisistes necessary continue puzzle . if you use it when you're not puzzle-view , it clarify your next objective . i found both these aspects very helpful . i experience one bizarre glitch game : intervals , without reason or warning , sound would suddenly start stutter echo most annoying way . adjusting game settings no effect . i eventually discovered i could correct problem exiting game rebooting my computer . this seemed necessary once every couple hours . i completed keepsake 25 hours -- possibly little more . i deligthed it kept me busy so long most adventure games these days barely provide 10 hours play . some second part game get little draggy , lot toiling back forth through castle . however , keepsake good choice gamers who like straight adventure fantasy context . but glitch couple illogical puzzles , i would given it five stars . i eagerly look forward wicked studios ' next effort

it because story ! strong plot crucial every rpg , kotor doesn't disappoint . this plot course includes one biggest twists video game history ( all you fans out there know what i'm talking ! if you don't , then go out buy this game now ) . game principal characters , while somewhat stereotypical ( i.e. bastila condescending socialite snob , carth tough loner troubled past , etc ) , work very well together good chemistry , including you , created character . example , if you play female character , it soon becomes obvious carth develops feelings you , but he feels slightly guilty because he lost his wife not too long ago . you'll also find yourself acting mediator when some your allies don't get each other , i.e. canderous carth , because they fought opposite sides mandalorian wars took place five years before . aside character development , game feels very rich its " star wars-ness " -- example , some names bioware came up planets people feel sound like george lucas himself approved them . despite what i said earlier this review , cutting down your enemies lightsaber looking good doing it got one joys kotor . i admit when i first got dantooine verge becoming jedi , i trembling excitement i going build my own lightsaber , i wondered what color i going choose . said all , there some things keep this game getting 5 stars . i felt game bit linear ( able choose your planets any order only gives illusion open-ended gameplay ) . i hoping storyline would different depending whether i decide evil or good , but everything plays same , save few minor events certain conversations . also , there " doorway bug " causes you sometimes get stuck when moving through doorway or narrow corridors . when this happens you wiggle thumbstick free yourself ; i've never any real problems this bug , but it get distracting . also i found moving around menu screens problematic ; you press start go main menu , then you pull trigger buttons move screens , but often i pull trigger multiple times before game responds . also , i'm sure many people would agree game graphics not up xbox standards ; even ps2 capable doing better ! i don't usually gripe graphics , but textures some background buildings taris downright laughable . overall , i give bioware serious kudos taking daunting task like creating new star wars game , i sing their eternal praises actually making it fun . it not stretch say i bought xbox just play kotor ( few other titles , but that story ) , i'm glad i made investment . hey , stop reading this go play
